titles: To the Right Honourable, the Commons of England assembled in Parliament. The humble petition of divers well-affected people, inhabitants of the cities of London and Westminster, the burough of Southwark, hamblets and places adjacent, promoters and approvers of the petition of the 11. of September, 1648.
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "The Levellers Petition Aug 21 1650".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Andrews, Eusebius, d. 1650 --  Early works to 1800.

Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
